results.title: Shenzhen Tianhui Xingye Technology Co., Ltd - Tianhui Xingye Technology
results.content: Shenzhen Tianhui Xingye Technology Co., Ltd was founded in Shenzhen city Guangdong province, China in 2012.
results.raw_content:
Shenzhen Tianhui Xingye Technology Co., Ltd was founded in Shenzhen city Guangdong province, China in 2012. As a professional manufacturer and exporter in wireless charger and related products, the company is engaged in research, development, production and sale of desktop wireless charger, stand charging dock, magnetic mobile charger, car wireless charger, multifunctional wireless charger, power bank phone charger, wireless charging receiver and so on. Under the leadership of CEO Mark Fu, Tianhui Xingye Technology has become a leading enterprise in our field.
Covering an area of 2000 square meters, we now have over 120 employees, an annual sales figure that exceeds US Dollar 14 million in 2019 and are currently exporting 60% of our production. The company is structured with complete functional departments, including development, production, quality control, warehouse, purchasing, marketing, logistics, financial and personnel. And we also have workshop of injection, assembly, SMT, testing, packing and repairing, so we have ability to ensure the safety, quality, stability and reliability of our products.
Our R&D team is specialized in both software and hardware, as well as individuation packing. And the team always keep exchange and cooperation with other partners in wireless charging industry, keep up with the market, be brave in technology innovation, ensure not to lag behind the trend, and also catch up with peers. Thus we are able to help our partners to win more markets.
All of our products comply with industrial and international standards and they are passed FCC, FCC ID , CE , RoHS international certification. And our wireless charger are compatible with Qi standard phones like mainstream brands such as Apple, Samsung, Huawei, Xiaomi and Oppo etc., as well as wearable devices like watch and earphone.
Other than supply standard products, our company is also with rich experience in OEM and ODM customization service. Our own private mold, original design, appearance patent and utility patent provide our partners more customized options and there is no copyright issues.
Our factory is located in Shenzhen, a modern international metropolises near to Hong Kong. The city is with good trading environment and highly developed international logistics. And we are also near to Yantian port, Shekou port, Baoan international airport and Hong Kong international airport, these advantages make us able to provide the best choice no matter you choose marine transportation, air transportation or express door to door service. And our sales team is a highly educated, experienced and enthusiastic team and we aims to provide customers with the best quality and the most competitive solutions, and strives to help our partners to maximize their interests.
We supplied our wireless charger to few phone manufacturers only at the beginning, but now our partner are from worldwide, including manufacturers, traders, wholesalers, retailers, distributors, supermarkets, stores and so on.The market scope has also gradually expanded from the United States and Western Europe to South America, Middle East, Southeast Asia, North America, Australia, etc.
We believe that with our continuous innovation and unremitting efforts, and with the support of our partners as always, we will continue to create greater brilliance and miracles! Welcome new friends to consult and expand business together!

results.raw_content:
NTT Global Data Centers Plans Massive New Campus in Northern Virginia
NTT Global Data Centers is expanding its presence in Northern Virginia with a massive new campus in Prince William County, the company said today. NTT has acquired property from Lerner Enterprises in Gainesville, Va. where it plans to develop 2 million square feet of data center space, supporting 336 megawatts (MWs) of capacity.
The 103-acre campus will provide room for long-term growth for NTT and its customers in Northern Virginia, where the company already operates a major campus in “Data Center Alley” in Ashburn, the primary cloud hub in Loudoun County.
NTT says the Gainesville project will become its single largest campus, with plans for four two-story data center buildings, with the first scheduled to come online in the second quarter of 2024.  The design will also offer “dedicated self-contained areas for large-footprint deployments” to support hyperscale clients.
“The development of a new data center campus in Virginia is testament to our huge growth and momentum across North America” said Doug Adams, President and CEO at NTT Global Data Centers Americas. “This strategic purchase of land is just one of the many steps we’re taking to accelerate our data center footprint across the country.”
NTT Global Data Centers Americas is in the midst of a major expansion, with construction projects underway across the U.S. to add more capacity. The company has spent the past two years entering new markets, opening data center campuses in Hillsboro, Chicago, Santa Clara and Phoenix.
“The development of our new campus in Virginia will be one of 14 ongoing projects taking place across the globe,” said Masaaki Moribayashi, President and Board Director, NTT Ltd. “By 2025, it is estimated that 95% of new digital workloads will be deployed on cloud-native platforms, up from 30% in 2021. As a result, the demand for data centers to support this shift has never been higher. As one of the largest data center providers in the world, NTT is well placed to support this reliance, and we’re focused on supporting our customers as their needs continue to change,”
Data Center Developers Look Beyond Ashburn
Northern Virginia has become the global capital for cloud computing, and is home to hundreds of data centers. That includes many hyperscale facilities operated by Amazon Web Services, Google, Microsoft and Meta, as well as data center developers who support their growth.
Data center development in Prince William County has accelerated in recent years as development parcels grow scarce near the regional data center hub in Ashburn in Loudoun County. There is now a growing cloud cluster near Manassas, and land speculation from developers has boosted property values, with recent transactions valuing data center development sites at nearly $1 million an acre.
There is now an estimated 5.3 million square feet of data center space in Prince William County, with another 8 million to 10 million square feet in the development pipeline, according to a recent report.
The NTT project is part of a data center building boom in Gainesville around the intersection of Route 66 and 29 (Lee Highway). The NTT property is across the highway from Gainesville Crossing, a large campus from Corscale that will feature 2.3 million square feet of data center space and 306MW of utility power.
Both projects are west of the proposed Prince William Digital Gateway, which could add millions of addition square feet of data centers and has generated lively debate about the appropriate location for future development in the county.
NTT Accelerates Global Data Center Expansion
The Gainesville campus is part of an ongoing global expansion for NTT, which plans to increase its data center footprint to more than 1,000 MWs in 20 countries by the end of 2022. NTT says its data centers in Prince William will be sustainable, as part of the company’s commitment to achieving net-zero emissions across its data center operations by 2030.
In addition to its U.S. campuses, NTT Global Data Centers recently announced the opening of data centers in Madrid, Navi Mumbai in India, and its largest data center in Indonesia in Jakarta. NTT Global Data Centers also has ongoing construction that will deliver new data centers in Germany, India, and Johannesburg later this year.
In the U.S., each campus is designed for multiple data centers, which allows customers who want contiguous space to easily add capacity in adjacent data halls or buildings. Here’s a look at the company’s US footprint:
In 2018 NTT Global (then known as RagingWire) launched its primary campus in Data Center Alley in Ashburn, shifting to greenfield construction, customized from the ground up to support the company’s vision for Internet-scale campuses.
The first building, VA3, is a 16 MW data center featuring a mix of vault designs from 2 megawatts to 6 megawatts of power capacity, as well as a large room for multi-tenant retail colocation. VA4 and VA5 are 32-megawatt buildings with expanded and standardized vaults, and VA6 will feature NTT’s new 36-megawatt design – two floors, with three 6-megawatt data halls on each floor.
At least three more data center buildings are planned for the Ashburn campus, totaling 224 megawatts of capacity. The Prince William campus will be 50 percent larger, providing a next phase of growth for NTT and its clients from 2024 forward.
Having capacity can provide an advantage, especially as customers seek accelerated delivery timelines to meet demand for cloud services.
“One of the things our client base has told us that they appreciate how we build ahead in our markets,” said Adams in a recent conversation with DCF.
Rich Miller

Ticket business department: responsible for travel business and product development.
Founded in 2005, Shenzhen Huoli Tianhui Technology Co., Ltd. is a senior mobile Internet company in China. It is positioned as a computing-centric intelligent travel platform. The travel services are based on "flight housekeeper" and "high-speed rail housekeeper". Service carriers such as APP clients, mini programs, and quick apps, which fully cover the three major travel scenarios of flights, railways, and private car connections, provide the following services around user travel: (1) Combine big data processing technology and machine learning technology for users Provide customized best travel organization plan; (2) Integrate various travel-related information services, transaction services and value-added services including dynamic travel information services, shuttle bus, insurance, hotel reservations, etc., to provide users with one-stop shop Online travel solutions. Dynamic data revenue service is the company's business scenarios, relying on professional data in the industry, through the interpretation and prediction of historical data, to provide partners with information services such as dynamic monitoring and prediction. The company has worked closely with various civil aviation units to enrich data dimensions and sources. On the other hand, relying on years of experience in travel data processing and application, it has established effective algorithms and predictive models for logistics, OTA, hotel, car use, insurance, etc. Provide data services for multiple industries within.
Location: There are two main locations where the work is performed Heifei and
Wuhan

results.title: SHENZHEN SHENGYE TECHNOLOGY CO.LTD - IFA Berlin 2023
results.content: Shenzhen Shengye Technology Co., Ltd. is an innovative smartwatch and fitness tracker manufacturer based in Shenzhen, China. Established in 2015, our company embraces cutting-edge technology to deliver exceptional wearable devices to the global market.
results.raw_content:
​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​
Exhibitors
SHENZHEN SHENGYE TECHNOLOGY CO.LTD
Shenzhen Shengye Technology Co., Ltd. is an innovative smartwatch and fitness tracker manufacturer based in Shenzhen, China. Established in 2015, our company embraces cutting-edge technology to deliver exceptional wearable devices to the global market. Our state-of-the-art factory spans over 1000 square meters and houses a dedicated workforce of 100 skilled professionals.
At Shengye, we specialize in crafting advanced wearable solutions that not only cater to the demands of tech-savvy consumers but also provide customized options for our esteemed partners. Our products have garnered widespread acclaim across 80+ countries, including prominent markets such as the United States, Mexico, Brazil, Peru, Colombia, Canada, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, the United Arab Emirates, Egypt, Algeria, Morocco, and more.
Driven by our unwavering commitment to quality, we maintain the strictest standards of manufacturing and quality control. Our Research and Development department comprises highly specialized experts who continuously innovate and design revolutionary products.
To ensure utmost reliability, our Quality Control team, consisting of six diligent professionals, meticulously tests every product, guaranteeing 100% functionality before reaching our customers. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive 12-month warranty on all our products, providing peace of mind to our valued clientele.

About Us
Shenzhen ShengShi TianHe Electronic Technology Co.,Ltd is a high-tech enterprise, engaged in production, research and development Power inverter, Photovoltaic solar energy series products, Emergency vehicle tools, UPS power supply and so on.
Our operating concept: Customers first, Co-trust, Co-benefit. Products are welcomed by clients from different countries.
Our factory was established in 2011 year, covers an area more than 5000 square meters and 7 piece of full-auto production line. We has more than 450 employees which including 65 R & D and management staffs. With well-trained sales team and experienced R&D team, we can customized products according to different client's requirement.
Our enterprise culture: Endless Improvement, Zero-defect Pursuit, Constantly improve goods quality and service, making us grow bigger day by day.
◆Our Product
Power Inverter, Universal Laptop Adapter, Solar Power Supply, UPS Power Supply, Switch Power Supply and Emergency vehicle tools, Solar energy products( Solar panel, Solar inverter, solar charge controller, solar power bank , battery charger, ect )
◆Product Application
Our products are widely used as the emergency power supply for computer, car and business travelling, home, medical care, mine and security fields as well as the fittings needed in various electronic enterprises.

DXC Technology Co - Company Profile

DXC Technology Co: Overview
DXC Technology Co (DXC) is an information technology (IT) and consulting services provider. The company’s service portfolio includes analytics, cloud applications, cloud infrastructure, enterprise applications, data security services, IT outsourcing (ITO), and workplace and mobility solutions. Its solutions are primarily focused on minimizing business risks and operational costs for clients. DXC caters to the insurance, healthcare and life sciences, aerospace and defense, consumer and retail, manufacturing and automotive, travel and transportation, hospitality, energy, utilities, oil and gas, technology, media and telecommunications, public, banking, and capital sectors. The company’s operations are spread across various regions including the Americas, Australia, and Europe. DXC is headquartered in Ashburn, Virginia, the US.
